examples: The small-town mayor has been punching above her weight recently, going head-to-head with federal lawmakers over the issue of immigration reform.

words.defineEn: involving direct confrontation between two sides
words.defineVi: liên quan đến cuộc đối đầu trực tiếp giữa hai bên

examples: Worse still, the increasingly intolerant Roman Catholic Church now deemed the Ethiopian sect of Christianity heretical.

words.defineEn: opposite to what is widely accepted
words.defineVi: trái ngược với những gì được chấp nhận rộng rãi

words.defineEn: not in agreement with generally approved principles, opinions, or beliefs

examples: It turned out that the vice president of the company had been orchestrating a hostile takeover when the president's back was turned.

words.defineEn: unfriendly or aggressive toward others
words.defineVi: không thân thiện hoặc hung hăng đối với người khác

examples: I was aware of her thinly disguised hostility.

words.defineEn: behavior or feelings that are aggressive or unfriendly
words.defineVi: hành vi hoặc cảm xúc hung hăng hoặc không thân thiện

examples: And these sales can become hot button issues like a recent sale proposal of Boeing harpoon missiles to Taiwan or a failed bid to sell the Patriot missile system produced by Raytheon to Turkey.

But I have to admit, the idea of women delivering in any position besides lying on their backs never occurred to me as a particularly hot button issue.
words.defineEn: a matter or problem about which people argue a lot and have strong feelings
words.defineVi: một vấn đề hoặc vấn đề mà mọi người tranh luận rất nhiều và có cảm xúc mạnh mẽ

words.defineEn: to politely express disagreement with what has just been stated
words.defineVi: để bày tỏ sự không đồng ý một cách lịch sự với những gì vừa được nêu

examples: I could have so many ill feelings about this industry.
words.defineEn: feeling of anger between people, particularly because of an argument
words.defineVi: cảm giác tức giận giữa mọi người, đặc biệt là vì một cuộc tranh cãi

examples: We've come to an impasse.

words.defineEn: a difficult situation where progress is not possible because the people involved are unable to come to an agreement

examples: Before the end of his first term, he took on the control of the Russian Parliament, which, in Yeltsin’s days, was referred to as irreconcilable opposition, dominated by irreconcilable opposition, torpedoing his every initiative.

words.defineVi: bị mắc kẹt trong một cuộc tranh luận hoặc tình huống khó khăn
